sense.name: available wealth or assets
sense.commentary: CAPITAL[+financial] Wealth in the form of money or property.
sense.examples: It will take a lot of capital to turn this idea into a product. The accumulation of capital led to the rise of wealthy nations.

sense.name: a seat of government or influence
sense.examples: What is the capital of Denmark? Mary named 40 out of 50 state capitals correctly. The fashion capitals of the world include Paris, New York and Milan.

sense.name: a letter represented in uppercase
sense.examples: The first word in each of your bullets should begin with a capital. He sent me an email message that was typed all in capitals.

sense.name: a book by Karl Marx
sense.examples: 'Capital' is the English translation of 'Das Kapital'. We read excerpts from Capital in class last semester.

sense.name: uppermost part of a column
sense.examples: The capitals on those columns are made of a rare black marble.
